poem:
Title: Where Olive Trees Dream

Warm-hearted majority yearns for silence,
Jews, Palestinians, commonfolk in resonance.
Yet, beware the friend with daggered assistance,
Stoking the flames of ancient resistance,
Cloaked in good intention, fueling distance.
In this dance of discordance, 
May we find the strength of persistence,
To unravel threads of ancient pain, 
Until only peace remains in our existence.
